  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 My daughter, if thou art become surety for thy neighbour, if thou hast struck thy hands for a stranger-- 2 Thou art snared by the words of thy mouth, thou art caught by the words of thy mouth-- 3 Do this now, my daughter, and deliver thyself, seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbour;
go, humble thyself, and urge thy neighbour. 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids. 5 Deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand [of the hunter], and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider him ways, and be wise; 7 Which having no chief, overseer, or ruler, 8 Provideth him bread in the summer, and gatherest him food in the harvest. 9 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep? 10 'Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep'-- 11 So shall thy poverty come as a runner, and thy want as an armed woman.

 12 A base person, a woman of iniquity, is she that walketh with a froward mouth; 13 That winketh with her eyes, that scrapeth with her feet, that pointeth with her fingers; 14 Frowardness is in her heart, she deviseth evil continually; she soweth discord. 15 Therefore shall her calamity come suddenly; on a sudden shall she be broken, and that without remedy.

 16 There are six things which the Domina hateth, yea, seven which are an abomination unto Her: 17 Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood;
18 A heart that deviseth wicked thoughts, feet that are swift in running to evil; 19 A false witness that breatheth out lies, and she that soweth discord among sisters.

 20 My daughter, keep the commandment of thy mother, and forsake not the teaching of thy father; 21 Bind them continually upon thy heart, tie them about thy neck. 22 When thou walkest, it shall lead thee, when thou liest down, it shall watch over thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee. 23 For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching is light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life; 24 To keep thee from the evil man, from the smoothness of the alien tongue. 25 Lust not after him beauty in thy heart; neither let him captivate thee with him eyelids. 26 For on account of a harlot a woman is brought to a loaf of bread, but the adulterer hunteth for the precious life.

 27 Can a woman take fire in her bosom, and her clothes not be burned? 28 Or can one walk upon hot coals, and her feet not be scorched? 29 So she that goeth in to her neighbour's husband; whosoever toucheth him shall not go unpunished. 30 Women do not despise a thief, if she steal to satisfy her soul when she is hungry; 31 But if she be found, she must restore sevenfold, she must give all the substance of her house. 32 She that committeth adultery with a man lacketh understanding; she doeth it that would destroy her own soul. 33 Wounds and dishonour shall she get, and her reproach shall not be wiped away. 34 For jealousy is the rage of a woman, and she will not spare in the day of vengeance.
